com.mapdigit.drawing

Class Graphics2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.drawing.Graphics2D

  • public final class Graphics2D
extends java.lang.Object
    This Graphics2D class provides more sophisticated control over geometry, coordinate transformations, color management, and text layout. This is the fundamental class for rendering 2-dimensional shapes, text and images on the JavaME platform.
    © Copyright 2010 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

      • drawChars

        public void drawChars(FontEx font,
             int fontSize,
             char[] data,
             int x,
             int y)
        Draws the specified characters using the current font and color. The offset and length parameters must specify a valid range of characters within the character array data. The offset parameter must be within the range [0..(data.length)], inclusive. The length parameter must be a non-negative integer such that (offset + length) <= data.length.
        Parameters:
        font - the font object.
        fontSize - the size of the font.
        data - the array of characters to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate of the anchor point.
        y - the y coordinate of the anchor point.

      • drawChars

        public void drawChars(FontEx font,
             int fontSize,
             char[] data,
             int offset,
             int length,
             int x,
             int y)
        Draws the specified characters using the current font and color. The offset and length parameters must specify a valid range of characters within the character array data. The offset parameter must be within the range [0..(data.length)], inclusive. The length parameter must be a non-negative integer such that (offset + length) <= data.length.
        Parameters:
        font - the font object.
        fontSize - the size of the font.
        data - the array of characters to be drawn.
        offset - the start offset in the data..
        length - the number of characters to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate of the anchor point.
        y - the y coordinate of the anchor point.

      • drawOval

        public final void drawOval(Pen pen,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height)
        Draws the outline of an oval. The result is a circle or ellipse that fits within the rectangle specified by the x, y, width, and height arguments.
        Parameters:
        pen - the pen used to draw the oval.
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be drawn.
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be drawn.
        width - the width of the oval to be drawn.
        height - the height of the oval to be drawn.

      • fillOval

        public final void fillOval(Brush brush,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height)
        Fills an oval bounded by the specified rectangle with the current color.
        Parameters:
        brush - the brush used to fill the oval.
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be filled.
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be filled.
        width - the width of the oval to be filled.
        height - the height of the oval to be filled.

      • drawImage

        public final void drawImage(int[] imageRGB,
             int width,
             int height,
             int dstX,
             int dstY)
        Draws the specified Image object at the specified location and with the specified size.
        Parameters:
        imageRGB - Image object to draw.
        dstX - x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the drawn image.
        dstY - y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the drawn image.
        width - Width of the portion of the source image to draw.
        height - Height of the portion of the source image to draw.

      • drawImage

        public final void drawImage(int[] imageRGB,
             int width,
             int height,
             int dstX,
             int dstY,
             int transpency)
        Draws the transparent Image object at the specified location and with the specified size
        Parameters:
        imageRGB - Image object to draw.
        dstX - x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the drawn image.
        dstY - y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the drawn image.
        width - Width of the portion of the source image to draw.
        height - Height of the portion of the source image to draw.
        transpency - specify the transparent color of the image.
